handNote.p: Main scribe of the manuscript. Rotund hand. e varies between round and horned, so does c. The main hand has a quirk in which ascenders of long, tall letters, especially þ, tend to wobble slightly, curving a bit left at the top and curving to the right at the bottom. Mixes both straight and lightning-bolt abbreviatory signs here, though lighting bolt signs are more frequent. This hand is identifiable with the main scribe of Cambridge, Corpus Christi College 421 (ECHOE handID DP0425).
Contemporary reviser, square and Caroline a, e with square head and prominent tongue, tall and lower s. Mostly avoids insertion comma.
Reviser, few instances in dark ink. Uses insertion comma.
